text: The 1974 Los Angeles Dodgers won the National League West by four games over the Cincinnati Reds, then beat the Pittsburgh Pirates in the 1974 National League Championship Series before losing to the Oakland Athletics in the 1974 World Series. == Offseason == * October 27, 1973: Rick Auerbach was purchased by the Dodgers from the Milwaukee Brewers.Rick Auerbach page at Baseball Reference * December 3, 1973: Sergio Ferrer was drafted from the Dodgers by the Minnesota Twins in the 1973 rule 5 draft.Sergio Ferrer page at Baseball Reference * December 5, 1973: Willie Davis was traded by the Dodgers to the Montreal Expos for Mike Marshall.Willie Davis page at Baseball Reference * December 5, 1973: Pete Richert was traded by the Dodgers to the St. Louis Cardinals for Tommie Agee.Tommie Agee page at Baseball Reference * December 6, 1973: Claude Osteen and Dave Culpepper (minors) were traded by the Dodgers to the Houston Astros for Jimmy Wynn.Claude Osteen page at Baseball Reference == Regular season == Mike Marshall set a record by pitching in 106 games in 1974, a record that still stands today.Single-Season Leaders & Records for Games Played from Baseball-Reference === Season standings === === Record vs. opponents === === Opening Day lineup === {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:left" |+ ! colspan="2" |Opening Day starters |- !Name !!Position |- |Davey Lopes || Second – 2, Athletics – 3 ||October 17||Oakland-Alameda County Coliseum|| 49,347 || 2:23 |- |} == Awards and honors == *National League Most Valuable Player **Steve Garvey *Cy Young Award **Mike Marshall *Gold Glove Award **Andy Messersmith **Steve Garvey *Comeback Player of the Year Award **Jimmy Wynn *NL Player of the Month **Tommy John (April 1974) *NL Player of the Week **Tommy John (Apr. 22–28) **Jimmy Wynn (May 6–12) **Mike Marshall (June 17–23) **Davey Lopes (Aug. 19–25) **Ron Cey (Sep. 16–22) === All-Stars === *1974 Major League Baseball All-Star Game **Andy Messersmith starter **Steve Garvey starter **Ron Cey starter **Jimmy Wynn starter **Mike Marshall reserve *Major League Baseball All-Star Game MVP Award **Steve Garvey === Sporting News awards === *TSN Pitcher of the Year Award **Mike Marshall *TSN Fireman of the Year Award **Mike Marshall *TSN National League All-Star **Jimmy Wynn **Andy Messersmith **Steve Garvey == Farm system == ==1974 Major League Baseball Draft== This was the tenth year of a Major League Baseball Draft. The Dodgers drafted 23 players in the June draft and six in the January draft. The top pick was pitcher Rick Sutcliffe from Van Horn High School in Independence, Missouri. Sutcliffe would go on to win the 1979 Rookie of the Year Award. The Dodgers traded him to the Cleveland Indians in 1982 but he would remain in the league through 1994. He accumulated a record of 171–139, was a three-time All-Star and won the 1984 National League Cy Young Award, while with the Chicago Cubs. They also drafted infielder Jim Riggleman in the fourth round. While he never made the Majors as a player he had a stint as the Dodgers Major League Bench coach and would become a successful Major League Manager with four different clubs. {| class="toccolours
